title: NaturalGeomorphologicFeature
description: A natural geomorphologic feature is a geomorphologic feature (i.e., landform) that has been created by natural Earth processes. For example, river channel, beach ridge, caldera, canyon, moraine or mud flat.

unitDescription-1.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-1.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

unitDescription-2.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-2.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

unitDescription-3.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-3.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

naturalGeomorphologicFeatureType.title: naturalGeomorphologicFeatureType
naturalGeomorphologicFeatureType.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">naturalGeomorphologicFeatureType: NaturalGeomorphologicFeatureTypeTerm</font> is a reference from a controlled vocabulary describing the type of geomorphologic feature.

activity.title: activity
activity.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">activity</font> property (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) contains a category term from a controlled vocabulary describing the current activity status of the geomorphologic feature (e.g., currently active, dormant, inactive, reactivated, etc.).
